inn1.comm: good length ball outside off, shaping fractionally... and called wide, looked a touch harsh
closer to the stumps, Roy steps out and blocks into the off side
slightly back of a length outside off, cocks the trigger but then lets it go
floaty drive from Roy, the ball swung away - actually lucky not to be called a wide, I reckon - as he tried to carve it on the up over cover
shortish on the hips, tries to tuck it away and a bit of movement defeats him, drops down off the thigh pad
comes across and pushes back to the bowler
touch too full from Abbott and Roy finishes the over by blamming a lofted drive straight back down the ground for the first runs off the bat
fullish on off stump, Hales presses forward and dabs it away
shorter, goes back and blocks down into the ground, the ball rolls back but wide of the stumps
spanked through the covers! Adjusted well, on to the front foot and flayed through the line of the ball outside off
good length, tight on off stump, blocked in front of square from the crease
short, 134kph and rising towards the ribs, Hales nudges one through backward square leg
back of a length outside off, opens the face and steers to backward point
comes forward and drives a length ball on the up, finds cover
eases on to the front foot and crunches a drive, Duminy does really well to dive after it in the covers and prevent four
ooh, excellent delivery, angled in and seaming like a boss past Roy's outside edge
goes for the booming drive, again Abbott gets some purchase from the surface and beats the bat
slightly back of a length, swings a horizontal bat but can't get it through the covers
Roy makes an early move down the pitch, elects not to chase a wide-ish delivery
full and straight, Hales works it back towards mid-on
good length outside off, drops back and guides the ball to backward point
good pace and bounce for Rabada, 140kph and rising past the top of Hales' vapid cut
reaching for it again, short enough to cut in the air through gully, well stopped on the third man boundary
Roy stays back and steers one more through point
pitched up on the toes and blocked
comes across to a length ball outside off and glides one more to third man
pitched up and driven, to the man in the covers this time
bit of width, Hales slashes in vain, past the bat again... Looks to be getting a tad frustrated

humped over the top, Hales was really busting to hit the cover off something, had to chase the drive, playing away from his body but there's was enough bat on it to clear the ring and win the race to the rope
back and across, chopped towards backward point
pitched up in the slot, mistimed drive to cover and that's another dot
on the stumps, Roy pushes it back towards mid-on
back of a length, 140kph over middle and off, Roy stands tall and defends

dug in short, Roy top-edges a hook... and it flies to Abbott running in from fine leg! Neither opener looked to have got the pace of the surface and Roy is the one to go trying to force his way up through the gears. The result is an awful squeal of metal on metal and an ungainly leg-trap dismissal
in the channel, Root drops back and leaves alone
pitched up around off stump, mechanical-looking check-drive from Root, rolls to mid-off
full toss, Root doesn't pick it up, only manages to bunt it to mid-off
lovely hands, not a bat ball from Abbott but it is caressed through midwicket from off stump, outruns the fielder to the fence
back of a length to compensate, Hales squires this wide of third man for a couple
shortish outside off, sits back to cut but picks out a fielder
props forward to defend on off stump
slightly short on off, drops back and punches into the covers
smashed! Hales rocks back and absolutely creams a pull to the boundary at deep square leg, flew flat and hard and almost all the way for six... Wasn't even particularly short from Abbott
dug in and Root drops back, fends it away to the leg side
fullish in the channel, comes forward and squirts a drive in front of square
punched back to the bowler along the ground
short again, Root takes on the bouncer this time and pulls his first run to fine leg
full outside off, 135kph half-volley from Rabada but Hales slams a drive straight to cover... Story of the innings so far
banged in short, slightly leg side and Hales half-ducks out of the way
angled in with the arm, defended back down the track
full outside off, driven half forward, plinked into the covers
slung down quite wide and Root has a flash at it, horizontal bat and he fails to connect
on the body and nudged away through square leg
fourth-stump line from Morris, tapped down defensively from the crease
back of a length, 138kph outside off, reaches out and dabs one more to third man
full length in the slot outside off, Root glides into a pleasant-looking cover drive... and sends it on a rail to the fielder
pitched up and pushed back down the ground, in front of mid-off and they get through for one
length on off, tight line and tapped into the covers

strangled lbw appeal as Rabada traps Root on the crease... Think he realised there was some inside edge involved, although it wasn't given as a run by the umpire. Probably missing leg, on the replay, too
banged in short, Hales lets it sail through behind him
another bumper and this time he tucks in, the ball stays around chest-height and Hales isn't worried about Barney Rubble as he cracks four through square leg
full on the pads, skimmed fine for one more
length in the channel, Hales opens the face and runs a couple wide of third man
in the air but between the two fielders at point/backward point! Hales was really stretching to get to the pitch, driving away from his body - got away with it
bit of width again, this time Hales steers it through gully along the ground
pitched up and driven square and Root shuffles across
angled in on off stump, Hales was on the move and wristily flicks to leg, finds midwicket though
full on off stump, Hales clumps it to the man in the covers
pitched up around off stump and drive, Root takes on AB's arm... and he would just have made it. The throw didn't hit, anyway
good length outside off, Hales lets it go
straighter line, tries to work off his pads... Wiese chases after it to clean up
short ball, 123kph outside off stump, Hales cocks his wrists but elects to leave
full of a length in the channel, Hales comes across and pushes one through the covers
uses the feet, gets to the pitch and lofts Wiese down the ground, fine of mid-on for Root's first boundary. Bit of tap to finish the over
lashed through backward point, struck really well by Hales, opening the face and touch and he gets it through the infield, between two men in the deep
on the stumps, worked into the leg side
fired in on the pads, deflects in front of square
angling in with the arm, 143kph and glanced neatly through square leg for one
pitched up in the channel, Root comes forward to drive with a nice high elbow... for zero reward. That's what old-fashioned virtues get you

pitched up and this time Root does it in the new young stylez, heaves through the line, falling away slightly, looks a bit of a mess... but manages to clear the leaping AB at mid-off and that will be four, thankyouplease
pitched up on off stump, pushed back down the track
shortens his length, Hales goes back and runs one to third man
tight lines from Wiese, tapped back down the track
full length, tailing in on the toes, Root whips to leg... but midwicket again cuts it off sharpish
length outside off, Root quickly hops on to the back foot and swishes a cut down to third man
slightly full, Hales comes across and guides a drive to the right of third man, they come hurtling back for two comfortably enough
full length, angling in on the stumps, Root pokes it back down the track to the bowler
beaten! Cramped for room as the ball shaped back in, Root was trying to cut and failed to get anything on it
dug in short, wheels the arms through a pull through backward square
jags the ball back in and Hales is caught on the crease, just a thin inside edge saves him... that's the 50 stand up, too
lovely bowling, goes wide of the crease and arrows the ball in, holds its line fractionally as Root aims a drive down the ground and is beaten
pitched up on off and Root manufactures a nurdle to leg, wide of mid-on and they scamper one
tossed up on the stumps, Root drills it back down the ground
pushes through a legbreak outside off, drops back and cuts to point
straighter line, the googly, I think, hits Hales on the pad outside leg as he aims a heave across the line
tossed up around off stump, goes back and steers to point again
flighted, on the stumps, Hales is down to sweep one through square leg
tossed up and worked back through mid-on by the ever-busy Root
back of a length outside off, Root throws the hands and top-edges a cut down to thrid man
tight on off stump, Root hops across and shows it a straight bat
Root marionettes his way down the pitch and spluts a lofted cover drive over the ring, no great attempt to hit the cover off but timed nicely
errant delivery, fired down the leg side
short ball, Root swivels on a pull
full length, Hales pushes a drive wide of the the man at cover
good length on off stump, Root drops back and stabs into the covers
tossed up on a full length, a squirty inside-out drive through square leg, sent on its way with a 'oooh' of dismay from Tahir
good length once more, Root strikes the pad but sliding down leg
full toss but dipping late, Root swipes across the line and can't quite time his shot through midwicket
driven, with that flat-footed open-faced style that proved his undoing in the Tests. But this is effective in ODIs, down through the gap to third man
faster and flatter on leg stump, nurdled to midwicket
down on one knee, looking for the massive mow, he connects well enough but he's picked out the sweeper at deep midwicket!
driven without timing, from deep in the crease
full length, on the toes, a bit of a leading edge out to cover
clipped to midwicket, good restrictive line and full length
floated up outside off, Root climbs onto it like a hungry lion and nearly slaps a toe-end to cover! Finds the gap and races away though. Will that help pick him up?
width, and tapped down to third man with a measured cut
turned to midwicket
eased back down the track
googly, well picked and tapped down to third man
worked into the gap to get off the mark
outside off, climbing off the deck, and forget my earlier sentiment, that is a very fine ball indeed! Extra bounce, Morgan can't get on top of the shot and spoons straight to point!
outside off, driven into the covers, and a rare misfield gifts a first run

edged, and what a catch from Amla! A firm-wristed poke outside off to the googly, and Amla, reflexively flinging himself to his right like a rampant salmon, plucks the flying edge in one hand, and England are now deep in the mire!
full and straight, attacking the leg stump and worked square
a lot on Root's shoulders now
full length, compact drive, back down the ground
clipped out to midwicket
wide on the crease, Buttler advances to meet it on the half-volley and tucks his shot to midwicket
leading edge! Loops teasingly into the covers, but falls just safe ... England are living dangerously now!
tossed up, driven back to the bowler
good flight and threat again, pushed tentatively away
teasing length, turning from middle to off, pushed back to the bowler
on the pads, googling down the leg-side and helped round the corner
Buttler taking his time, Tahir pinning him down
off the mark, but that's another tight and threatening over for a rejuvenated performer
up on the toes, and dabbed to point
shot, attacking the lid with sharp lift and aggression, Buttler pulls loosely, a flimsy top-edge, ricochets off the helmet, and that is a massive, massive punch to England's collective kidneys!
full length, swinging gently away from the left-hander, pushed back up the pitch
tight and constraining. England have no option but to dig deep for now
very full again, pushed back up the pitch
outside off, through to the keeper. That's a wicket maiden. Brilliant work
eased up to long-on with a flowing drive
outside off, back of a length, dabbed to point
compact drive to long-off. Singles will suffice for now
outside off, turning away, pushed out to cover
ripper! A fizzing googly, turning, bouncing and beating the left-hander. Tahir is at the top of his game now
sharp work in the covers from Morris to pounce on a well-timed drive. South Africa are all over this contest at the moment
lovely clip into the gap at wide long-on, very full length, and swinging onto the left-hander's pads. Wiese dives full-length to intercept the boundary
eased round the corner

edged, and Amla has another! Moeen has a mow, up on the toes, trying to force the pace through the covers, but Abbott's line and lift off the deck was too much for him to control. A much more regulation snaffle this time, and England are in utter disarray!
two slips lurk as Abbott pushes the new man back into the crease with a back-of-a-length sighter
shoulders arms, keeps low as it scuds through to the keeper. England can but limp towards 200 and hope ...
tossed up and pushed down the ground
on the toes ... clipped to midwicket
nurdled ... effectively
very full, tossed above the eyeline and dipping late into the blockhole. Defended to mid-on
clipped to the leg side
a low full toss, pulled into the leg-side, rather as you might pull a reluctant donkey out of a stable. Not very effectively
up on the toes, defended back down the pitch
back of a length, Root attempts a whip to leg but can't time his stroke
whipped from a very full length, looked to be aiming through the leg side but somehow punches arrow-straight down the ground
full, poked to cover with flat feet
short and flashed through square leg with the enthusiasm and speed of a lost bedouin diving into an oasis.
defended into the leg-side
short and flat, pulled hard out to the midwicket sweeper
flight and bite on leg stump, cautiously repelled
straight lined push out to wide mid-off
on the pads, flicked fine
worked into space in the covers, off the back foot
turned out to square leg, another exemplary over from the cock-a-hoop Tahir. There is, quite literally, a spring in his step. He has turned into Zebedee since those wickets
short, and pulled out to deep midwicket
full and straight, cranking up the pressure
no chance to work any angles, back to the bowler

a fraction too short and short-arm-pulled to de Villiers at midwicket, who shies instantly and pings down the stumps with Woakes sprawling for the crease. Unluckily for him, the deflection gives away a run anyway
de Villiers fields and flings in one motion, leading by example with everything he does
jabbed down through the cordon, where Amla is alert and stoops to field
forward and punched into the covers
worked out to deep midwicket, the crowd is now making its own entertainment as England strive to take the fun out of the rest of this innings
up on the toes and inside-edged to short square leg
defended again, back down the track
full and straight, oodles of space down the ground to steal a single
nudged out to point
up on the toes, an ambitious punch into the covers
up and over the covers with a stretched lofted cut/drive. He scampers back for two, and there is his fifty. A fine lone hand... who can stay with him?
stunning from Amla who leaps on an edged drive down through the cordon to save a certain four. A wide full-toss but Morris got away with it
tighter line, pushed back up the pitch
full again, sharp drive, half-stopped by Morris's fingertips and mid-off does the rest
short, a slower-ball bouncer, Root waits and waits, and pulls calmly out to deep midwicket
on the pads, very full, worked out to square leg
short, and smartly played, inside the line and pulled confidently over backward square leg. A few more of them will help England's cause
on the pads as Woakes hops across the crease
wide on the crease, Root wears this one on the thigh pad as he misses his clip to leg
short, and smashed high and hard over the leg side as Wiese drags his length back a smidgeon. Good proactive batting
short, and Root goes after it again but doesn't get the whole of his bat on the pull through the leg side, a steepling top-edge but it lands safe at midwicket
full face of the bat, driven hard back down the pitch
worked into the gap
full and clipped to leg
defended down to third man with a trapdoor-like snap of the wrists
flashed hard through third man, enough width to justify dismantling the plumbing and throwing the entire IKEA range at it
fuller length, and pushed up to mid-off. That will be drinks
teasing stuff, Woakes played for this, I think, opening the face and running a length ball fine of third man... No slip in, so pretty safe, Woakes tickling Wiese with his pink feather boa
angled in and worked away through the leg side with a turn of the hands in the other direction
shortish, drops back and pulls one in the air through square leg
full on the pads, squirted away square for another single - that's the 50 stand, too
pitched up on the stumps, Root punches one back through mid-on
angled in with the arm, Woakes clips ot to midwicket
Root comes forward on off stump
shortish and worked away through square leg with a cross-batted swipe
full length on the stumps, turned to the leg isde
Morris drops short, threatens to get big on Woakes but he manages to keep his pull down
full length, Root squirts a drive towards backward point... where du Plessis races to his left and leaps on it like a panther, brilliant work
on the stumps, nurdled to one side of mid-on and they go haring through - a direct hit would have been interesting!
length ball, presses forward on off stump
shortish, 128kph over off stump, jumps back and flicks it to mid-on
Wiese offers a little bit of width and Root doffs his cap, thwacks a cut beyond the dive of Tahir at deep backward point
full on the pads, expertly manoeuvered through backward square leg this time, Morris does a more impressive job of stopping it
pitched up and punched down the ground
length on the stumps, Woakes essays a mini-flamingo flick, straight to midwicket
pitched up and driven towards mid-off, extra cover can't get there diving across
drops back outside off and dabs one behind square on the off side
slightly short and whumped through midwicket, Root was so quick to seize on that, timed it superbly on the short-arm jab
short again, this time he mistimes the pull

Root skips out and carts a length ball over mid-on... all the way! Another sweet connection, though probably helped by the minimal resistance provided by the Joburg air, just plopped beyond the boundary rope
swings at one outside off, thick-edge down to third man
tossed up on the stumps, poked back to the bowler
tossed up and driven, off an inside edge
flighted, Root comes forward and punches one down the ground
legbreak on middle and leg, Woakes can't get it away
floated up on the legs, Woakes goes back and flicks one square
pushed through, possibly the googly, nearly sneaks past the bat but Root manages to squeeze one through backward square jabbing down on it
goes back and runs one to third man
length outside off, Woakes opens the face and runs to third man, they come back for two
full length, comes forward and drives to mid-off
banged in, Woakes rocks into position and crumps a pull out to deep midwicket
fullish, comes forward and picks out a man on the drive
slower ball from Abbott, Root is all over it like a knitted jumper, helps a pull past short fine leg and away for four. He's into the 90s
tossed up, googly and Woakes plays with the turn through the leg side
too full from Tahir, gets down early and paddles a couple more fine... One blow for back-to-back tons?
no, he'll carry on as he was going, shuffles out and trickles one down the ground
outside off, legbreak and Woakes runs it off the face to short third man, Root calls early and makes it
tossed up and drive back to the bowler

pinned, up goes the finger! But Root review it straight away... It was straightening on leg stump but does he get some bat on it? Yes, looks that way, only a faint spike on Ultra Edge but you can see the deflection as the ball passes the bat, then squirts into the pad... So it is overturned and Root can battle on
good length outside off, possibly a cutter, Woakes pushes at it and misses
skips out and chips the ball towards long-on, underhit and it bounces to the man coming in
full outside off, Root spears drive through the covers - 200 up for England, looked a long way off 15 overs ago
in the channel, drops back and runs the ball down to third man
pitched up, Root walks out and punches through the covers to the sweeper
Woakes leaves his crease, trying to disrupt Wiese's length, he fires the ball on the tramline and the batsman misses
back of a length, swatted round the corner to fine leg

banged in short, Woakes sticks up his bat like a periscope - and tickles it to the keeper! Rabada breaks the stand at 95, a bit too quick for Woakes, I think, and his lollipop across the line comes to grief. He's done a fine job of staving off a complete collapse, though
back of a length, over middle and leg, Rashid jumps into line and flicks to leg
Root waits in the crease and clips one more through the leg side
excellent ball to a No. 9, quick and rising outside off, Rashid pokes at it in vain
pitched up, shuffles into line and squeezes the ball out to third man
slightly full and fetched up and over the covers, Rashid plays a punkish drive on the up and beats the man out at deep extra cover
beats the outside edge this time, too short for the attempted drive
glimpse of the Rashid bottom hand as he whirls a single through midwicket
full and straight, sliding on to the pads and Root tucks it away like a man filing paperwork - that's his hundred, second in a row out in SA. He's given England something to bowl at
slips another one past the outside edge as Rashid prods from the crease
slapped towards cow corner, that'll bounce away across the untended pastures... Mighty hoick from Rashid and he's into double-figures
drops a little short and Root flips him like pancake over deep midwicket, despite Tahir's yell of "catch it!"
tossed up on the pads, glanced through midwicket for a couple more
oh, hello, it's the Misbah dummy... Root went to the off side, as if to paddle-sweep, then at the last moment adjusted his wrists and dabbed it fine past the keeper
comes forward and punches one down the ground, hit firmly to long-on
tossed up outside off, Rashid watches this one through
length ball around off, drops back and stabs it away through point for one more
length outside off, Rashid throws the car boot at it, gets a thick edge wide of de Kock for four!
closes the face, this has gone wrong, a big leading edge out towards long-off... but Behardien drops it having charged in and made the ground!
comes across and squeezes the ball out square on the off side

full length outside off, Root goes across and tries to scoop... and sends it up and down, straight to short fine leg! Nice idea but he got more elevation than length and Tahir makes no mistake, hovering underneath it. Root was completely out of gas, no more running for him as he tried to make the ball do the work
good length outside off, Rashid tries to hammer a drive through the covers, misses
full outside off, poked into a gap in front of point
angled in with the arm and Rashid takes it on the full and slides a couple to fine leg
loses his line down the leg side
short ball, Rashid swings his arms like a helicopter and fetches it over backward square leg, away for four
full on the stumps, aims a swipe down the ground and gets a thick edge through the leg side for one more
length outside off, Broad slaps it through the covers half forwards
full length in the channel, Rashid can't get under a drive through the covers
full toss and it's flashed to the fence! Broad opens up and swings his nine iron, slicing the ball over backward point and away
goes full and wide and Rashid opens the face on a chunky slap wide of third man, Wiese does well on the boundary to keep them to three
dug in short, 131kph outside off, Broad flails at the ball, attempted uppercut... but fails to connect
Broad backs away, Abbott follows him... too far down the leg side
fired full, decent yorker from Abbott, dug out back past the bowler for one
full outside off, swipes over cover point, opening up the face, gets it into a gap for two
slower ball... but flumped down the leg side
pitched up in the channel and Rashid charges across to slice a couple more over backward point
sprayed leg side again - but this time Dharmasena decides it touched the pad on its way by
angled across, Broad's weight was on his back foot, swings and misses
Broad lumps a leg-side shovel into the hands of long-on! Slower ball from Rabada, mistimed heave for cow corner and Duminy makes sure to cling on after settling under it. Rabada has another
length ball, arrowing down the leg side and Rashid only needs to nudge it away fine for a boundary
slightly back of a length, Rashid dabs it down into the ground trying to run to third man

full outside off, Rashid makes room to hit over the ring... but screws his drive to the left of mid-off, where de Villiers dives to finish the innings off! A spirited knock from Rashid but England are dismissed short - in both senses, most likely

inn2.comm: good line and length, rising into the hip, defended down into the crease
wide on the crease, Broad's favoured restrictive line, slightly too leg-sided and flicked off the pad behind square
sweet drive, instant timing as Broad overpitches a fraction but Morgan at mid-off dives full-length and cuts off the runs
full again, driven to mid-on
dabbed down to third man to get off the mark
outside off, Amla dangles a bat and Broad worms his way through the gate, via an inside edge and onto his off stump! The comeback king strikes in his first over!
outside off, left alone
flashed into the covers, but gathered with a scurry
back of a length, angling back into the left-hander, defended
good teasing line, outside off, just a hint of shape away towards the cordon. A well-judged leave
forward and blotted back down the pitch
outside off, watchfully patted into the covers, that's a maiden and a very fine one too
full toss, and edged down to third man, a bit of a stumble as du Plessis turns but he's safely back
dabbed to third man
outside off, and chopped with sublime timing out through point for a welcome boundary
onto the front foot, and driven into the covers
clipped to short midwicket
pushed to the off side
lovely shape to the right hander, hooping back towards middle stump and demanding a block
short-arm pull, and an immediate look of horror as Woakes at deep midwicket scurries in to gather a toe-ender, but the ball died just in front of his tumbling effort
fully forward, pushed to the off-side
lovely line, angling across the bows as du Plessis shoulders arms
into line and defended
jabbed to cover, and a scampered single to keep the strike
forward and blocked, late indrift
driven hard into the covers, except that's a fat inside-edge into the boot. The intent was there, not the application
forward and patted into the gap back behind the bowler. A long chase, just a case of putting the bat in the way on a full length
clipped to midwicket
emphatic strike, onto the front foot, slashing the bat through the line and clubbed leg-side of straight, back down the ground. Broad aiming full and fuller but de Kock is equal to the challenge
a scrambled stop in the covers from Morgan. Good over for South Africa
thudding line and length from Topley, seems to be holding back on pace but finding a very probing line with a nibble of movement
a crumb of width, and du Plessis's greedy drive is too early, an inside-edge rumbles down into his crease
across the crease and chipped up and over the infield. No men close to any sort of a catch at midwicket
straight drive again, Topley can't intercept in his followthrough but good tag-team fielding limits the damage as du Plessis hesitates
eased into space on the leg-side. Acres of room
on the pads, clipped firmly in front of square. Lovely
outside off, driven on the up but well intercepted
open face, an attempted glide down to third man
slightly wide and angled towards the slips but middled with a gentle, exploratory drive into the covers
seeking to lay bat on everything, this one is squirted to point
that is gorgeous. Just whittled through the covers with balance, footwork, and placement. Not an awful lot wrong with the ball, just everything right with the shot
much wider, de Kock has a wallop and toe-ends a stretched drive to short cover
clipped hard to midwicket
picks off the single
firm compact drive, complete with a pleasingly echoey click of willow. But mid-off is well placed to intercept
defended back down the track, back of a length but straight as a gently curving arrow
rising outside off, nudged down to the third man boundary. Sharp running
that's the one. In the slot, Topley's line deserts him as du Plessis swings into a long half-volley outside off. But blimey, he drilled that! Head right over the ball and pummelled through the covers
dabbed into the off side
short and pulled out to square leg, got through the shot before the ball really arrived
up onto the toes to defend back down the track. Good line and length so far
rising outside off stump, de Kock plays one-handed into the covers. Just because he can
he makes it look so easy. Full length, on off stump, angling away, and de Kock shuffles in the crease and flicks fiercely through midwicket
not like that he doesn't, a loose long-hop down the leg side. Which is just as well, as any straighter and they'd been looking for that in Sandton
better line and left alone
dabbed away
outside off, and a hopeful late cut, inside edged past the stumps. Lucky ...
too full, too easy. Opens the face and drives through the line. Roy at backward point gets an earful for failing to cut that off
left alone outside off
nudged away to keep the strike and end the Powerplay
dabbed into the off side
stops in the track a touch as du Plessis gets behind the line to defend to cover
a bit of drift as du Plessis shoulders arms
dabbed into the leg-side
too short and that's fabulous. Du Plessis short-arm shovels through the leg side, the shot of a man whose eye hasn't been affected by the break
a little bit of drift towards the slips as du Plessis leaves alone
over the wicket, angled across the left-hander. Defended
good delivery, bowling to his off-side field, and climbing through to the keeper
shape away from the left-hander. de Kock puts his bat on the ball, scampers a single back past the bowler
outside off, pushed into the covers
dabbed out to point
worked to the leg side
a bit of width outside off, de Kock reaches for the drive and defends back to the bowler
similar ball, similar shot. Woakes parries as he fields
de Kock bides his time as Woakes probes a full length on off stump
short, pulled firmly but Moeen is lurking in the deep, and gathers on the bounce to limit the damage
defended
a bit of hooping late swing and Buttler is momentarily interested as the ball reaches his gloves after grazing past the bat on the half volley
turned off the pads to midwicket
tight line, full length, compact defence on off stump
short, and flumped out to midwicket. Pulled with a sound akin to a sock of sand. Not timed

bowled him! De Kock has been stopped, he's chopped it onto his leg stump! Tight line outside off, tried to manufacture a run down to third man but the ball wasn't there for such shenannigans, and Stokes has got the scalp that England most desperately needed...
tight on the defence, good line and length
that's a lovely over, tight to off stump again, de Villiers eases himself into line to defend

bowled him! Stunning from Woakes, full, swinging, unstoppable, as du Plessis' stumps are splattered, tailing in, then bursting away, and the leg bail zings off into the stratosphere. This is getting tasty now! England persevered and got their reward, and there's a fight to the finish on the cards now ...
full length, low full toss, and pushed into the covers
good line and length once more
short and sharp, very tight to the left-hander, who would have been in strife if he'd tried to play that
outside off, through to the keeper, this is a very important spell taking shape
excellent dot-joining. It's making a pretty picture for England
too full and de Villiers is onto that with alacrity, but that's an outstanding diving stop from Hales in the deep. Full length and goalkeeper style
dabbed down to third man
Duminy biding his time
driven with one hand into the off side, snaffled at short cover
gently driven into the covers, setting himself for the long haul
up onto the toes, eased out to the deep
outside off, swinging away, can't connect with an ambitious pull
driven into the leg-side

edged and dropped! Hales is livid with himself as Woakes pushes a scrambled seam across Duminy's bows, but second slip  - two slips at this stage - goes for the chance in front of first, and shells it!
outside off, and steered down to third man
outside off, and again, a tight line
chopped hard out to deep cover, a bit more width. Duminy brings up 4000 ODI runs. Well done him.
Stokes charges in and angles the ball across Duminy, who leaves
pitched up and driven, half forward, sends it to mid-off
presses on to the front foot and steers the ball in front of square to the sweeper
yee ha! De Villiers whirls his lasso round his head and rattles a short ball to the fence, power to burn, in front of deep midwicket
dug in short again and pulled to the man on the fence this time

round thew wicket, fired in and rapping the pads, Stokes likes it... but umpire George says no. England review immediately and this is going to be tight. Duminy was shuffling across to drive, beaten on the inside and it ricocheted off front and back pad - but was he outside the line of off? Yes! Well, sort of... It's umpire's call, by the thinnest whisker, with the ball projected to to take out middle stump. Small margins and all that but Duminy endures

pitched up and sliced on the drive, straight to backward point who takes a blinder drops it! Jason Roy made the leap to his right, seemingly had it in his hands... but then shelled it as he fell to the ground. Broad has to abort his celebration
full in the channel and slammed through the covers, no doubt about this one, beats the sweeper - four
skips forward, takes Broad head on again, dumps him into the stands at long-on! Mighty blow from AB, he's going to slug this one out with his Test nemesis right here and now
good length, this time he gets a leading edge that lands short of mid-off
shortish, goes back in the crease and nudges one to backward square leg
back of a length, angled in from round the wicket, Duminy slaps it to backward point
over the wicket, tossed up and worked to the leg side
round the wicket to the left-handed Duminy, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up, attempts to get to the pitch and drive, can't get it through
flighted, shuffles across and pokes into a gap in front of square
angled in on the stumps, de Villiers tickles one down the ground
flat offbreak outside off, Duminy reaches for it and swats one to the sweeper
back of a length outside off, Duminy chops a forceful baseball blow back down the ground
slightly short, outside off and fading away, lets this one go
banged in, feeble half-tracker from Broad, dispatched with a first-class stamp through midwicket for four
goes round the wicket, slightly short of a length outside off, left alone
drops back outside off, shoulder arms again
shortish, waits for it on the back foot and punches the ball square
tossed up around off stump, defended coming forwards
flatter, goes back in the crease and punches a single down the ground
good length on the stumps, AB defends watchfully
tossed up, turning in on off stump, again blocked from the crease
angled in on the stumps, worked towards midwicket
flighted on middle stump, de Villiers watches it under his nose and whips one to deep midwicket
decent line, straightening to hit the shoulder of the bat as AB pokes at it from the crease
dug in short, rising sharply over off stump as Duminy takes evasive action
another bumper, this time he takes it on, pulled firmly down into the ground, deep square leg has to move around and they get two
short of a length, 140kph on the stumps, gets in behind it
goes full and straight, Duminy chops down on it in defence
short and wide, Duminy pops up out of his hole like a hermit crab and goes snap! snap! Four lashed through backward point
on the stumps, punched down the ground
tossed up and driven coming forwards, back past the bowler
angling in, AB stays in the crease and works it to midwicket

goes down to sweep, Moeen appeals for lbw, he's convinced he didn't hit it... If there was no bat, it was might close, the ball spinning in to hit in front of middle and off. But runs are signalled and England don't have a review
round the wicket, drifts leg side and he gets it away fine
tossed up on the stumps, de Villiers clips one more through the leg side
back of a length, over the stumps, de Villiers taps it down to the on side
full length, shaping away and right in AB's slot, he leans into a brutal drive over extra cover, flies away with extra chili sauce
slightly short and crunched through midwicket! De Villiers looks like he means business now, that wasn't a bad ball but he wound up and tally whacked it past mid-on with barely a blink
on the body, flicked away for one
Duminy goes across and defends

brilliant from Woakes, he's run out AB! Tried to steal a single and the bowler swooped in his follow through, hurled under arm and AB is short by half a yard! Woakes knows it and is celebrating immediately, they'll check upstairs on the replay but England are cock-a-hoop... Is that the moment that turns the game?
tossed up and defended in front of the stumps
angled in, flicked away for a single
pushed through on off stump, goes across and works towards mid-on
on the stumps and tapped away
floated up, leans out and punches a single back down the ground to get off the mark
tossed up outside off, Behardien leans out and drives a couple into a gap at cover
strikes this really well, coming forwards smoothly and drilled in front the man at deep cover
flighted, spinning away outside off, pushed into the covers
googly, spinning away outside off as Duminy goes back and across and misses with a swipe - called wide
tossed up on the stumps, goes down to sweep
floated up and pushed into the covers
on the stumps, Behardien punches another single through the covers
flighted on the stumps, tickle down the ground for one
bit of width and Duminy picks up a boundary, dropping back to cut late through backward point
on the pads, flicked into a gap square
goes back and across to defend
length ball on off stump, Behardien tries to whip to leg, can't get it away
fired in quicker, blocked with the toe of the bat
tossed up on the stumps, Duminy plays with the turn through backward square leg
legbreak on the stumps, Behardien can't get it away
floated up, comes forward and pushes through mid-off for one
gives it some air, possibly the googly, tapped back towards the bowler
floated up a bit higher and Duminy gets down to paddle the ball fine, they hustle back for two

gives it a rip and Duminy is trapped plumb in front! Poor decision to play back, from the looks of it, Rashid got the ball to spin into the batsman from over the wicket, he was rooted in front of off stump, hit on the knee roll and that looked a straightforward decision - he's not reviewing and SA are five down
floated up around off stump, Behardien works back down the ground
bit wider, comes forward and pushes a single through the covers
floated up nice and full, jams down on it driving through mid-off
spinning in, goes back and flicks one fine
tossed up, Wiese levers it back down to long-off with his gangling reach
goes back in the crease and nurdles one more to leg
gives ti some air, room for Behardien to swing his arms through a drive wide of long-off
tossed up and tapped into the covers
Wiese gets a stride in, gets this one through in front of square - 150 up for SA

beats the bat as Behardien gropes forward... was that a missed stumping? Buttler didn't gather it cleanly, Behardien's foot was out of the crease but it would have required lightning reflexes to remove the bails intime
tossed up a little straighter and nudged away to the leg side
Wiese goes back to cut and gets a top edge wide of slip! Quite a thick connection and Stokes, I think, didn't really have a chance as he stretched out a hand
nudged with an open face down to third man
tossed on a good length outside off and worked out to midwicket
straightens on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
spinning sharply onto the pads and helped on its way to deep square
good ball, lots of air, dipping late, and zipping sharply into a back-foot defence. The shy goes awry and they come back for an overthrow
eased to midwicket. A quietly accumulative over
nudged into the gap
up onto the toes, eased down to long on
too short, Behardien shimmies at the crease, thinks long and hard why to thump it, and chooses cow corner in the end, as all such decisions eventually end up being
tapped into the covers and a good sharp run
good line, wicket to wicket, turning towards the off side and helped with the spin to cover
lots of air, flogged out to deep cover. Runs coming at a comfortable rate for South Africa
tight line, squeezed into the covers
shorter and wider, a bit of turn and bounce and Buttler ignores a flail of bat in front of him to gather neatly over the bails
worked into the leg side
sharp running, on the pads, tickled fine and always hustling back for two
angled bat, poked to point
whipped across the line out to deep midwicket
on the back foot, and punched into the covers
into line and defended
outside off, and chopped hard through backward point. Well timed and placed
working with the spin, a quick jog through to keep the strike rotating
patted back to the bowler
another sharp run into the covers, a direct hit would have been very tight, but the under-arm shy slides harmlessly by!
sweetly timed and placed into the covers
sharp spin onto the hip, helped round the corner
inside-edged out to the leg side
tossed onto the toes, clipped slightly uppishly to midwicket
low full toss, drilled into the deep
patted out to backward point, and there's an initial mix-up that could have been curtains, but Broad fumbles and the moment is lost!
on the pads, rustled into the leg side, more sharp running as they turn quickly
on the pads, fine leg tidies up. Stokes hasn't quite found his line yet
tighter line, angled in but holding its line on off stump. Cagey defence off the back foot
too fine tor Buttler to cut that off. Misdirected, more leg-side freebies
better line and length, straight as they come and punched back up the pitch
tails in late from wide on the crease, and Wiese nearly chops on with a dab from deep in the crease. Lucky!
over the wicket with his left-arm line, targetting the pads, clipped to midwicket

wow! A full length, a flat hard chip straight down the track, and Topley belies his lumbering Gus Fraser-lite frame to stick out his left mitt, pinch his forefingers round the ball as it whipped past his knees, and Behardien has to walk!
up on the toes, angled bat down to third man
very full, very straight, a massive appeal! But the umpire reckons there was an inside edge on that, and sure enough, there was. Well played ump
fractionally short, not quite middled with a roundhouse mow. But valuable runs all the same
good return to the fray for Topley. South Africa are in control of the run-rate but their wickets are waning
driven firmly out to cover, good bat on ball, right behind the line
back of a length, tapped out to short cover and another shaky quick single
a wristy drill, down to third man. Rashid sweeps up
tight line once again
up on the toes, on the back foot, jabbed to midwicket
angled into the off stump, defended out to point
tapped out to the deep and up comes South Africa's 200. Little more than a run a ball from here
outside off, angled across the right-hander who leans back into a flicky sort of dab through point but can't connect, to Buttler's dismay and partial relief
full again, cramping for room to free the arms
a solid thump through the leg side as Topley drops short.  But he's got the fielders back to tidy up
full again, and dug out
short and a leaping uppercut ensues, any sort of bat on that would have flown. But he can't connect
full length, reaching for late movement, pushed back up the pitch from deep in the crease
stunning stop at short midwicket! Just a fraction short, a short-arm pull through midwicket and a brilliant snaffle on the half-voilley, low to his right. Stings the wrist, but he's alright
whittled down to the short leg-side boundary
clipped off the pads and bobbles into the leg-side
crashing drive, fat outside edge. Effective enough

flings it out wide, it would have been called as such, but Wiese reached for it, found a toe-end and short cover gobbled up the offering with glee! Stokes has the scalp, and come in Kagiso, your country needs you!
sign of intent as Morris winds up with a baseball slug out to deep midwicket. Two bounces and fielded on the fence
on the hip, swung away violently, but only as far as deep square leg
gone, first ball! Morgan offered his bowler a slip, Topley accepted it with glee, and a firm drive from Rabada is grabbed by Root at the second attempt!
open face, driven calmly out to deep extra cover. Morris has the strike back with two balls to go
takes a step back, a wild flap out to the deep, Rashid is under it, surely for the series ... but it's dropped! Got both hands to it but was never steady. Will that be costly?
slower ball, so slow it barely has enough velocity to reach the batsman. Dribbles down the leg side and that is the end of another successful over
poked into the off side
outside off, pushed through, a useful dot
dabbed into the covers, a suicide run to mid-off, and Morgan almost had time to walk that onto the non-striker's stumps. Instead he snatches at the underarm shy, and misses
slower ball, very wide, a thick edge down to third man
big inswinger, heading down leg after pinning Morris on the foot. Buttler gathers well
a crashing drive back over the bowler's head. Moeen tidies up on the long-off boundary. South Africa keep chiselling away...
a crunched drive to mid-off
short, and lifting uncomfortably into the ribs. Abbott rides the bounce with a wince
smashed back past the bowler, or not, as it happens, as Topley lummoxes down to the ground to stop the single with impressive agility
fractionally too short and that has been leathered into the crowd! This isn't over yet! Morris can middle it given half a chance, and he did so right there
slower ball, a low full toss on the pads. Good connection but only a single out to deep midwicket
crunched hard back down the pitch and that's very unlucky. A perfect connection with the non-striker's middle stump kills the shot dead
it's fewer than a run a ball now!A fat edge down to third man, and a sprawling dive almost cuts off the four. Instead the ball rolls tantalisingly along the rope before brushing the sponge
smashed! In the slot and torpedoed over cow corner! That was a sensational strike, and he barely left his pose, let alone the crease
too wide, and slammed out to the point boundary. Moeen knee-slides to save the four, but that wasn't the right ball for his field
a horrid wide, Woakes is trying too hard and this one gets stuck in his knuckles
much better, fuller and straighter, and beats a tentative crease-bound push
outside off, drilled out to the cover sweeper
back of a length, trying to steal a singel to short cover, but wisely turned down ...
wide of the crease, Morris rocks back, sensing the length and absolutely battering it into the stratosphere at deep midwicket!
full and flogged through the covers! He's got a 30-ball fifty, and the match in the palm of his hands!
slower ball, but it makes no difference! Morris is seeing it like a comet, and Broad is burning up like the Philae Lander as it approaches the sun!
driven more circumspectly for a single to long-off, and Abbott has two balls to survive. In the absolute most literal sense. It's a one-man show now ...
outside off, and Abbott earns one of the biggest cheers of the day for a calm shouldering of the arms
solid crease-bound defence, and an utterly redundant raise of the palm to his colleague to stay "stay there!" You don't say!
that is a nut and a half in the circumstances. No close fielders whatsoever, and a pearling inswinging yorker that demands a block and nothing else
shorter but straight again, taking the pace off the ball, and Morris tries to wind up a leg-side wallop but is beaten ...
on the pads, a swivel-pull over the leg-side and that is a stunning riposte! South Africa are almost home and hosed!
low full toss but booming inswing, that's the ball for the moment and Morris can't get it away
smashed down the ground, is that the match? No! Well fielded at mid-on, and Abbott has one ball to face
dabbed into the covers, Abbott does his part of the bargain ... now then Chuck
googly, and Rashid has stunned the Wanderers! Wow, it's like a vacuum cleaner has parked its nozzle over the top of the stadium. Morris had a wipe, glory in sight, but didn't pick it whatsoever!
legbreak, big spin, Tahir mows through the covers, for the win!
